# Loading package 
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(glue)
library(here)
library(janitor)
library(skimr)

public1private2 = function(x){
  x = as.integer(x)
  case_when(
    x == 1 ~ "public",
    x == 2 ~ "private",
    TRUE ~ NA_character_) %>% as.factor()
}
```

# Curating each data
Since the column names of each of the data are not consistent as of 16 May 2020, ref commit 96a1d8c55c5f17b22526e8e68c0bfd30799911eb, I will load each data by itself, clean and assemble at the end. 

See the Google Sheet for the commonly agreed variables. 

## 2000

```{r}
sch_2000 = read_rds(here("Data/Output/2000/sch_qqq.rds"))
glimpse(sch_2000)

clean_2000 = sch_2000 %>% dplyr::transmute(
  country = cnt %>% as.factor(),
  school_id = schoolid %>% as.factor(), 
  fund_gov = sc04q01 %>% as.numeric(),
  fund_fees = sc04q02 %>% as.numeric(),
  fund_donation = sc04q03 %>% as.numeric(),
  enrol_boys = sc02q01 %>% as.numeric(),
  enrol_girls = sc02q02 %>% as.numeric(),
  stratio = stratio %>% as.numeric(),
  public_private = sc03q01 %>% public1private2(),
  staff_shortage = tcshort %>% as.numeric(),
  sch_wgt = wnrschbw %>% as.numeric(),
  school_size = schlsize %>% as.numeric())

skimr::skim(clean_2000)
```

# Binding data

```{r}
# Ensure all datasets have the same type for school_id and public_private before binding (converting to character)
list_data <- lst(clean_2000, clean_2003, clean_2006, clean_2009, clean_2012, clean_2015, clean_2018, clean_2022)

# Remove "clean_" from the names
names(list_data) <- names(list_data) %>% str_remove("clean_")

# Convert both school_id and public_private to character in each dataset to avoid type conflicts
list_data <- list_data %>%
  map(~ .x %>% 
        mutate(
          school_id = as.character(school_id),
          public_private = as.character(public_private)  # Convert public_private to character
        ))

# Bind the rows and convert character columns to factors
school <- list_data %>%
  bind_rows(.id = "year") %>%
  dplyr::mutate(school_id = as.factor(school_id),
                public_private = as.factor(public_private)) %>%  # Convert public_private back to factor
  dplyr::mutate_if(is.character, as.factor) %>%
  as_tibble()

# Skim the data to inspect
skimr::skim(school)


```

# Saving data (rds file)
```{r}
saveRDS(school, file = here("Data/Output/school.rds"), compress = "xz")
```
